what: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Samesies reliability tool comparing lists texts, factors, numerical values measure similarity. package’s motivating use case evaluating consistency Large Language Model (LLM) responses across models, providers, prompts.

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
code: devtools::install_github("dylanpieper/samesies")

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Samesies provides three main functions similarity analysis:

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists character strings. Methods available via stringdist (e.g., method = "osa"): Transformational Algorithms osa: Adjacent transposition edits lv: Basic edit distance dl: Comprehensive edit distance transpositions Structural Comparison hamming: Position-wise character differences lcs: Longest shared subsequence qgram: Subsequence matching cosine: Vector-space string similarity jaccard: Set-based string comparison Linguistic Matching jw: Prefix-weighted string matching soundex: Phonetic encoding
code: r1 <- list("R is a statistical computing software",             "R enables grammar of graphics using ggplot2",             "R supports advanced statistical models") r2 <- list("R is a full-stack programming language",            "R enables advanced data visualizations",             "R supports machine learning algorithms")  tex <- same_text(r1, r2)

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists categorical data. Methods available (e.g., method = "exact"): exact: Exact matching order: Distances across ordered factor levels
code: cats1 <- list("R", "R", "Python") cats2 <- list("R", "Python", "R")  fct <- same_factor(cats1, cats2,                     levels = c("R", "Python"))

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists numeric values. Methods available (e.g., method = "exact"): exact: Exact matching pct_diff: Percentage difference normalized: Normalized difference (set max_diff auto-calculate) Uses relative absolute tolerance thresholds fuzzy matching method calculates numeric similarity using relative (default 2%) absolute (default 0.05) tolerance Values within maximum two epsilon thresholds considered exact matches (score 1) Similarity scores gradually decrease difference grows beyond threshold
code: n1 <- list(1, 2, 3) n2 <- list(1, 2.1, 3.2)  num <- same_number(n1, n2) num <- same_number(n1, n2,                     method = "normalized",                     max_diff = 2.2) num <- same_number(n1, n2,                     method = "fuzzy",                     epsilon = 0.1,                    epsilon_pct = 0.05)

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: input two lists, pairwise comparisons across lists computed.

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Nested lists supported long share names lengths.

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: three functions return similar objects support following methods: print(x, digits = 2): Displays similarity scores rounded specified digits summary(x, digits = 2): Provides detailed statistics customizable precision average_similarity(x, method = NULL): Calculates mean similarity, optionally specific method pair_averages(x, method = NULL): Returns pairwise average similarities, optionally filtered method

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: package uses S7 objects, allowing direct access underlying data using @ operator: @scores: list similarity scores method comparison pair @summary: list statistical summaries method comparison pair @methods: similarity methods used analysis @list_names: Names input lists @raw_values: original input values

title: Measure Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers

title: Calculate Similarity Scores Between Two Numeric Lists — calculate_number_scores

title: Calculate Similarity Scores Between Two Numeric Lists — calculate_number_scores
text: list1 First list numeric values list2 Second list numeric values method Method use similarity calculation. One : "exact", "pct_diff", "normalized", "fuzzy" epsilon Threshold fuzzy matching. used method "fuzzy" max_diff Maximum difference normalization. used method "normalized" epsilon_pct Relative epsilon percentile (default: 0.02 2%). used method "fuzzy"

title: Calculate Similarity Scores Between Two Numeric Lists — calculate_number_scores
text: Vector numeric similarity scores 0 1

One : "exact", "pct_diff", "normalized", "fuzzy" epsilon Threshold fuzzy matching. used method "fuzzy" max_diff Maximum difference normalization. used method "normalized" epsilon_pct Relative epsilon percentile (default: 0.02 2%). used method "fuzzy"

title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
text: S7 object type "similar_factor" containing: scores: Numeric similarity scores method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Methods used comparison list_names: Names compared lists levels: Levels used categorical comparison

what: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: Computes similarity scores two lists numeric values using multiple comparison methods.

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
code: same_number(   ...,   method = c("exact", "pct_diff", "normalized", "fuzzy"),   epsilon = 0.05,   epsilon_pct = 0.02,   max_diff = NULL )

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: ... Two lists containing numeric values compare method Character vector specifying similarity methods (default: ) epsilon Threshold fuzzy matching (default: NULL auto-calculation) epsilon_pct Relative epsilon percentile (default: 0.02 2%). used method "fuzzy" max_diff Maximum difference normalization (default: NULL auto-calculation)

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: S7 object containing: scores: list similarity scores method list pair summary: list statistical summaries method list pair methods: similarity methods used list_names: Names input lists raw_values: original input lists

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
code: nums1 <- list(1, 2, 3) nums2 <- list(1, 2.1, 3.2) result <- same_number(nums1, nums2) #> ℹ Using auto-calculated max_diff: 2.2 #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "nums1_nums2" [mean: 0.333] #> ✔ Computed pct_diff scores for "nums1_nums2" [mean: 0.963] #> ✔ Computed normalized scores for "nums1_nums2" [mean: 0.955] #> ✔ Computed fuzzy scores for "nums1_nums2" [mean: 0.978]

what: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
code: same_text(   ...,   method = c("osa", "lv", "dl", "hamming", "lcs", "qgram", "cosine", "jaccard", "jw",     "soundex"),   q = 1,   p = NULL,   bt = 0,   weight = c(d = 1, i = 1, s = 1, t = 1) )

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: ... Lists character strings compare method Character vector similarity methods stringdist. Choose : "osa", "lv", "dl", "hamming", "lcs", "qgram", "cosine", "jaccard", "jw", "soundex" (default: ) q Size q-gram q-gram based methods (default: 1) p Winkler scaling factor "jw" method (default: 0.1) bt Booth matching threshold weight Vector weights operations: deletion (d), insertion (), substitution (s), transposition (t)

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: S7 class object type "similar_text" containing: scores: Numeric similarity scores method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Methods used comparison list_names: Names compared lists

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
code: list1 <- list("hello", "world") list2 <- list("helo", "word") result <- same_text(list1, list2) #> ✔ Computed osa scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed lv scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed dl scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed hamming scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0] #> ✔ Computed lcs scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed qgram scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.889] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.92] #> ✔ Computed jaccard scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.9] #> ✔ Computed jw scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.953] #> ✔ Computed soundex scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.5]

what: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: similar S7 abstract parent class similarity comparison objects. class defines common properties validation logic shared among child classes like similar_text, similar_factor, similar_number.

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
code: similar(   scores = list(),   summary = list(),   methods = character(0),   list_names = character(0) )

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: scores List similarity scores per method comparison summary Summary statistics method comparison methods Character vector methods used comparison list_names Character vector names compared lists

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: class provides foundation similarity comparison classes. includes common properties: scores: List similarity scores per method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Character vector methods used comparison list_names: Character vector names compared lists also implements common validation logic ensuring scores numeric fall within valid range 0 1. Child classes inherit class implement specific validation logic allowed methods additional properties.

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
text: similar_factor S7 class categorical/factor similarity comparisons.

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
